lab3

temp.cpp 
 1 /********
 2  *
 3  * lab3
 4  * problem 1
 5  *
 6  * Write a simple program that convert the temperature in degree Celsius to degree Fahrenheit and vice versa using the basic concept of class and object. Make separate class for Centigrade and Fahrenheit which will have the private member to hold the temperature value and make conversion functions in each class for conversion from one to other. For example you will have function toFahrenheit() in class Celsius that converts to Fahrenheit scale and returns the value. 
 7  *
 8  */
 9 // header file for input and output operation
10 #include <iostream>
11 // using standard namespace
12 using namespace std;
13 #define SUCESS 0
14 /**
15  * Centigrade class that store centigrade values and convert it into ferhenhiet
16  */
17 class Centigrade
18 {
19 private:
20   float temperature;
21 public:
22   Centigrade(float t){temperature = t;}
23   float toFerhenheit()
24   {
25     return (temperature)/100*180+32;
26   }
27 };
28 
29 /**
30  * Centigrade class that store centigrade values and convert it into ferhenhiet
31  */
32 class Ferhenheit
33 {
34 private:
35   float temperature;
36 public:
37   Ferhenheit(float t){temperature = t;}
38   float toCelcius()
39   {
40     return (temperature-32)/180*100+0;
41   }
42 };
43 
44 int main()
45 {
46   float temp;
47   int choice;
48   cout << "Select temperature unit to change into another"<< endl;
49   cout << "1. Celcius" << endl;
50   cout << "2. Ferhenheit" << endl;
51   cin >> choice;
52   if (choice == 1)
53     {
54       cout << "Enter temperature in celcius" << endl;
55       cin >> temp;
56       Centigrade C(temp);
57       cout << "temperature in Ferhenheit " << C.toFerhenheit();
58       
59     }
60   else if (choice == 2) 
61     {
62       cout << "Enter temperature in ferhenheit " << endl;
63       cin >> temp;
64       Ferhenheit F(temp);
65       cout << "temperature in Celcius " << F.toCelcius();
66       
67     }
68       
69   
70    return SUCESS;
71 }
prime.cpp 
 1 /********
 2  *
 3  * lab3
 4  * problem 1
 5  *
 6  * 
 7  *
 8  */
 9 // header file for input and output operation
10 #include <iostream>
11 // using standard namespace
12 using namespace std;
13 #define SUCESS 0
14 /**
15  * Assume that you want to check whether the number is prime or not. Write a program that asks for a number repeatedly. When it finishes the calculation the program asks if the user wants to do another calculation. The response can be 'y' or 'n'. Don't forget to use the object class concept.
16  */
17 /*
18  * class Number
19  */
20 class Number{
21 private: 
22   int num;
23 public:
24   Number(int n){num = n;}
25   bool isPrime()
26   {
27     if (num < 2) // prime no is defined for natural no greater than 2
28       return false;
29     else
30       for (int i = 2; i < num/2; i++) // brute force all the factor possible 
31 	{
32 	  if (num % i == 0) // i is found to be the factor
33 	    return false;
34 	}
35     return true;
36   }
37 };
38 int main()
39 {     
40   int temp;
41   char choice;
42   do 
43     {
44       cout << "Enter no to Check?";
45       cin >> temp;
46       Number no(temp);
47       if (no.isPrime() )
48 	cout << "Number is prime" << endl;
49       else
50 	cout << "Number is not prime" << endl;
51       cout << "Do you want to continue y/n";
52       cin >> choice;
53     }
54   while(choice == 'y');
55   return SUCESS;
56 }
carpark.cpp 
 1 /********
 2  *
 3  * lab3
 4  * problem 3
 5  *
 6  * Create a class called carpart that has int data member for car id, int data member for charge/hour and float data member for time. Set the data and show the charges and parked hours of corresponding car id. Make two member functions for setting and showing the data. Member function should be called from other functions.
 7  *
 8  */
 9 // header file for input and output operation
10 #include <iostream>
11 // using standard namespace
12 using namespace std;
13 #define SUCCESS 0
14 
15 /**
16  * carpark class 
17  */
18 class Carpark 
19 {
20 private:
21   int id;
22   int charge;
23   float time;
24 public:
25   /*Carpark(int i, float c, float t)
26   {
27     id = i;
28     charge = c;
29     time = t;
30   }*/
31   void setId(int i){id = i;}
32   void setCharge(int c){charge = c;}
33   void setTime(float t){time = t;}
34   int getId(){return id;}
35   int getCharge(){return charge;}
36   float getTime(){return time;}
37   float getTotalCharge(){return time *charge;}
38   void displayInfo()
39   {
40     cout << "Id of carpart is " << getId() << endl;
41     cout << "Charge/hour "<< getCharge() << endl;
42     cout << "Time parked "<< getTime() << endl;
43     cout << "Total charge "<< getTotalCharge() << endl;
44   } 
45 };
46 
47 int main()
48 {
49   Carpark park; 
50   int id, charge, time;
51   cout << "Enter car id";
52   cin >> id;
53   cout << "Enter charge per hour";
54   cin >> charge;
55   cout << "Enter time parked";
56   cin >> time;
57   
58   park.setId(id);
59   park.setCharge(charge);
60   park.setTime(time);
61   
62   park.displayInfo();
63   return SUCCESS;
64 }
employee.cpp 
 1 /********
 2  *
 3  * Sujit Maharjan
 4  * lab3
 5  *
 6  * problem 5
 7  * Assume that an object represents an employee report that contains the information like employee id, total bonus, total overtime in a particular year. Use  array of objects to represent n employees' reports. Write a program that displays report. Use setpara() member function to set report attributes by passing the arguments and member function displayreport() to show the reports according to parameter passed. Display the report in following format. 
 8  *
 9  *   Employee with ... ... ... has received Rs ... ... ...as bonus and
10     had worked ... ... ... hours as a over time in  year ... ... ... 
11  *
12  */
13 #include <iostream>
14 
15 using namespace std;
16 
17 #define SUCCESS 0
18 
19 class employee
20 {
21 
22 private:
23 
24   int id;
25   int bonus;
26   int overtime;
27   int year;
28 
29 public:
30 
31   void setpara(int i, int b, int o, int y)
32   {
33     id =i;
34     bonus = b;
35     overtime = o;
36     year = y;
37   }
38   void displayreport()
39   {
40     cout << "Employee with id " << id << " has received Rs. " << bonus << " as bonus and had worked " << overtime << " hours as a over time in year " << year << endl; 
41   }
42 
43 };
44 
45 int main()
46 {
47   int n;
48   cout << "Enter the no of employee?";
49   cin >> n;
50   employee e[n];
51   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
52     {
53       int id, bonus, overtime, year;
54       cout << "Employee id:";
55       cin >> id;
56       cout << "Bonus:";
57       cin >> bonus;
58       cout << "Overtime:";
59       cin >> overtime;
60       cout << "Year:";
61       cin >> year;
62       e[n].setpara(id,bonus,overtime,year);
63     }
64   for (int i = 0; i< n ; i++)
65     {
66       e[n].displayreport();
67     }
68   return SUCCESS;
69 }
objects.cpp 
  1 /********
  2  *
  3  * lab3
  4  * problem 4
  5  *
  6  * Write a program with classes to represent circle, rectangle and triangle. Each classes should have data members to represent the actual objects and member functions to read and display objects, find perimeter and area of the objects and other useful functions. Use the classes to create objects in your program.
  7  *
  8  */
  9 // header file for input and output operation
 10 #include <iostream>
 11 #include <math.h>
 12 // using standard namespace
 13 using namespace std;
 14 #define SUCCESS 0
 15 #define PIE 3.14
 16 #define true 0
 17 #define false 1
 18 /**
 19  * circle class
 20  *
 21  * \data members float radius
 22  * \members perimeter
 23  * \members area
 24  */
 25 class Circle  
 26 {
 27 private:
 28   float radius;
 29 public:
 30   bool set(float r)
 31   {
 32     // data validation
 33     if(r > 0)
 34       {
 35 	radius = r;
 36 	return true;
 37       }
 38     else
 39       {
 40 	cerr << "Radius must be greater than 0" << endl;
 41 	return false;
 42       }
 43   }
 44   void read()
 45   {
 46     int r;
 47     cout << "Circle" << endl;
 48     do 
 49       {
 50 	cout << "Enter the radius of the circle";
 51 	cin >> r;
 52       }
 53     while(set(r));
 54   }
 55   float perimeter(){return 2 * PIE * radius;}
 56   float area(){return PIE * radius * radius ;}
 57   void display()
 58   {
 59     cout << "Circle" << endl;
 60     cout << "Radius :" << radius << endl;
 61     cout << "Perimeter :" << perimeter() << endl;
 62     cout << "Area :"<< area() << endl;
 63   }
 64 };
 65 /**
 66  *
 67  * Class rectangle
 68  *
 69  * \data members float length
 70  * \data members float breadth
 71  * \members perimeter
 72  * \members area
 73  */
 74 class Rectangle
 75 {
 76 private:
 77   float length;
 78   float breadth;
 79 public:
 80   int set(float l, float b)
 81   {
 82     // data validation
 83     if (l <= 0 || b <= 0)
 84       {
 85 	cerr << "length and breadth should be positive" << endl;
 86 	return false;
 87       }
 88     else
 89       {
 90 	length = l;
 91 	breadth = b;
 92 	return true; 
 93       }
 94   }
 95   void read()
 96   {
 97     float l, b;
 98     cout << "Rectangle" << endl;
 99     do
100       {
101 	
102 	cout << "Enter length and breadth?";
103 	cin >> l >> b;
104       }
105     while (set(l,b) == false);
106   }
107   float area(){return length*breadth;}
108   float perimeter(){return 2*(length+breadth);}
109   void display()
110   {
111     cout << "Rectangle" << endl;
112     cout << "length :"<< length << endl;
113     cout << "breadth :"<< breadth << endl;
114     cout << "Area :"<< area() << endl;
115     cout << "Perimeter :"<< perimeter() << endl;
116   }
117 };
118 /**
119  *
120  * Class Triangle
121  *
122  * \data members float a,b,c
123  * \members area
124  * \members perimeter
125  */
126 class Triangle
127 {
128 private:
129   float a, b, c;
130 public:
131   int set(float s1, float s2, float s3)
132   {
133     // triangle validation
134     if (s1 < (s1+s2) && s2 < (s3+s1) && s3 < (s1+s2)) // sum of two sides of the triangle is always greater than the third
135       {
136 	a = s1;
137 	b = s2;
138 	c = s3;
139 	return true;
140       }
141     else
142       {
143 	cerr << "Unvalid triangle. sum of two sides of a triangle should always be greater than third"; 
144         return false; 
145       }
146   };
147   void read()
148   {
149     float s1, s2, s3;
150     cout << "Triangle" << endl;
151     do
152       {
153        
154 	cout << "Enter sides a b and c?";
155 	cin >> s1 >> s2 >> s3;
156       }
157     while (set(s1,s2,s3) == false);
158   }
159   float perimeter(){return a+b+c;}
160   float area()
161   {
162     float s = perimeter()/2;
163     return sqrt(s*(s-a)*(s-b)*(s-c));
164   }
165   void display()
166   {
167     cout << "Triangle" << endl;
168     cout << "sides a " << a << " b " << b << " c " << c << endl;
169     cout << "Perimeter " << perimeter() << endl;
170     cout << "Area " << area() << endl;
171     
172   }
173 
174 };
175 
176 int main()
177 {
178  
179   Circle circle;
180   Rectangle rectangle;
181   Triangle triangle;
182   
183   circle.read();
184   circle.display();
185   rectangle.read();
186   rectangle.display();
187   triangle.read();
188   triangle.display();
189   
190   return SUCCESS;
191 }
